oracle.cloudstorage.ftm

Class FileTransferManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.cloudstorage.ftm.FileTransferManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CloudClient

    public class FileTransferManager
extends Object
implements CloudClient
    Utility to manage file transfers to and from Oracle storage cloud.

    It provides APIs to upload and download single or multiple files in a simple but efficient manner with high throughput.

    The utility uses multiple threads to upload simultaneously multiple segments for a large file upload. It manages the required resources such as connections to the cloud service and threads.

    Exceptions

    The methods in this interface may throw following exceptions:

    • ClientException - if the client API failed to process the request or the response from the server.
    • ServiceException - if the storage cloud service returned an error or unexpected response.

      The methods that accept a container name may throw following exception (in addition to those listed specifically for individual methods):
    • InvalidContainerName if the container name is invalid

      The methods that accept an object name may throw following exception (in addition to those listed specifically for individual methods):
    • InvalidObjectName if the object name is invalid
    Since:
    1.0

      • upload

        public TransferResult upload(UploadConfig uploadConfig,
                    String containerName,
                    String objectName,
                    File file)
                      throws ClientException,
                             ServiceException
        Uploads a file to storage cloud.

        The API returns after the upload is completed or throws an exception if there is any error during upload operation.

        A large file (of size greater than the segment size specified in upload load configuration) is uploaded as a static-large object (SLO) with the segment size equal to the segment size specified by upload configuration.

        Note about Server-side Encryption (SSE) Support

        • Uploading a small object: If the container does not exist, then it is created with no SSE policy set. So, to upload a file to a container that supports server-side encryption, such a container must exist before calling this API.
        • Uploading a static-large object (SLO):
          • If both the containers (object's container and segments' container) do not exist, both are created with no SSE policy set.
          • If the object's container already exists and segments' container does not, then a segments' container is created with same SSE policy (if it exists) as that of the object's container.
          • If the object's container does not exist and segments' container already exists with a SSE policy of BASE_ENCRYPTION , then an exception ContainerSSEPolicyMismatch is thrown.
          • If both the containers already exist, then both must have a SSE policy of BASE_ENCRYPTION or both should not have a SSE policy set. If not, an exception ContainerSSEPolicyMismatch is thrown.
        Parameters:
        uploadConfig - Upload configuration. May be null.
        containerName - container name. If container does not exist, it will be created.
        objectName - Name of the object for the file to be uploaded. May be null. If null, then the file's name(without the path) will be used as object name.
        file - file to be uploaded
        Returns:
        result of the transfer operation
        Throws:
        ContainerSSEPolicyMismatch - if the SSE policy of the object container and the SLO segments' container does not match
        ContainerStorageClassValidationFailed - if the storage class for object specified in uploadConfig does not match with storage class of an existing container.
        ObjectExists - if the uploadConfig specifies Overwrite parameter as false and the object already exists
        FileSizeTooBig - if the file to be uploaded is too big
        SegmentSizeTooSmall - if the segment size (for uploading a file as SLO) is too small
        ClientException
        ServiceException

      • uploadAsync

        public TransferTask<TransferResult> uploadAsync(UploadConfig uploadConfig,
                                       String containerName,
                                       String objectName,
                                       File file)
                                         throws ClientException,
                                                ServiceException
        Initiates an upload of a file to storage cloud.

        This is an asynchronous version of method upload(UploadConfig, String, String, File). Refer to that method for details about behavior and exceptions thrown. The exceptions thrown by this asynchronous API could be recovered from the cause of exceptions thrown by TransferTask.getResult().

        Parameters:
        uploadConfig - Upload configuration. May be null.
        containerName - container name. If container does not exist, it will be created.
        objectName - Name of the object for the file to be uploaded. May be null. If null, then the file's name (without the path) will be used as object name.
        file - file to be uploaded
        Returns:
        TransferTask object to track the operation
        Throws:
        ClientException
        ServiceException

      • uploadDirectory

        public MultiFileTransferResult uploadDirectory(UploadConfig uploadConfig,
                                      String containerName,
                                      String objectPrefix,
                                      File directory,
                                      boolean includeSubdirectories)
                                        throws ClientException,
                                               ServiceException
        Uploads all files in the specified directory to storage cloud.

        The object names for each file is generated as follows:

        • If the input includeSubdirectories is false, object name is <objectPrefix><file name>.
        • If the input includeSubdirectories is true, the object name is <objectPrefix><absolute file path name not including the input directory path>.

        By default, hidden files and directories are included in the transfer operation. To exclude the hidden files and directories, use the excludeHiddenFiles option in uploadConfig.

        Parameters:
        uploadConfig - Upload configuration. May be null.
        containerName - container name. If container does not exist, it will be created.
        objectPrefix - common prefix for the object names.
        directory - directory to upload
        includeSubdirectories - Indicates whether to include all files in sub-directories for upload. If false, only the files in the specified directory will be uploaded. Default is false.
        Returns:
        result of the transfer operation
        Throws:
        ClientException
        ServiceException

      • uploadDirectoryAsync

        public TransferTask<MultiFileTransferResult> uploadDirectoryAsync(UploadConfig uploadConfig,
                                                         String containerName,
                                                         String objectPrefix,
                                                         File directory,
                                                         boolean includeSubdirectories)
                                                           throws ClientException,
                                                                  ServiceException
        Initiates an upload of all files in the specified directory to storage cloud.

        The object names for each file is generated as follows:

        • If the input includeSubdirectories is false, object name is <objectPrefix><file name>.
        • If the input includeSubdirectories is true, the object name is <objectPrefix><absolute file path name not including the input directory path>.
        Parameters:
        uploadConfig - Upload configuration. May be null.
        containerName - container name. If container does not exist, it will be created.
        objectPrefix - common prefix for the object names.
        directory - directory to upload
        includeSubdirectories - Indicates whether to include all files in sub-directories for upload. If false, only the files in the specified directory will be uploaded. Default is false.
        Returns:
        TransferTask object to track the operation
        Throws:
        ClientException
        ServiceException

      • download

        public TransferResult download(DownloadConfig downloadConfig,
                      String containerName,
                      String objectName,
                      File file)
                        throws ClientException,
                               ServiceException
        Download an object from storage cloud to specified file.

        If the object is in an archive container, then

        • if the object is in a restored state, then its download will be initiated.
        • Else:
          • if downloadConfig has isDownloadRestoredObjectOnly set to true, then an ObjectNotRestored exception is thrown.
          • Else, a restore operation will be initiated and 'RestoreInPorgress' will be returned immediately as the transfer state in TranferResult.
        Parameters:
        downloadConfig - download configuration. May be null.
        containerName - container name for object to be down loaded.
        objectName - Name of the object to be down loaded.
        file - file to download the object to.
        Returns:
        result of the transfer operation
        Throws:
        InvalidDestinationFile - if the specified file parameter is invalid
        FileNotWritable - if the specified file is not writable
        FailedToCreateParentDirectory - if failed to create the parent directory for the specified file
        ClientException
        ServiceException
        ObjectNotRestored - if downloadConfig has isDownloadRestoredObjectOnly set to true and the object is not in a restored state.

      • downloadAsync

                                         String containerName,
                                         String objectName,
                                         File file)
                                           throws ClientException,

        Parameters:

      • downloadDirectory

        public MultiFileTransferResult downloadDirectory(DownloadConfig downloadConfig,
                                        String containerName,
                                        String objectPrefix,
                                        File destinationDirectory)
                                          throws ClientException,
                                                 ServiceException
        Download files from cloud storage into a directory.

        The objectPrefix will be removed from destination file name for the object. If the object contained directory hierarchy, then the same directory hierarchy will be created in the destination directory.

        For example, for a container container1, objectPrefix my_prefix, destination directory /abc/dir2, an object '/container1/my_prefixdir1/object1' will be downloaded as '/abc/dir2/dir1/object1'.

        Parameters:
        downloadConfig - download configuration. May be null.
        containerName - container name for objects to be down loaded.
        objectPrefix - Common object prefix of all objects to be downloaded. May be null.
        destinationDirectory - Directory to download all objects to. Directory will be created if it does not exist.
        Returns:
        Transfer result for all files.
        Throws:
        ClientException
        ServiceException

      • downloadDirectoryAsync

        public TransferTask<MultiFileTransferResult> downloadDirectoryAsync(DownloadConfig downloadConfig,

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the FileTransferManager gracefully and releases all resources that may have held.

        Waits for all threads to shut down gracefully.

      • shutdownNow

        public void shutdownNow()
        Shuts down the FileTransferManager now and releases all resources.

        Forcefully shuts down all the executing threads now and releases all the resources that may have been held.

        public CloudContainer createSSEEnabledContainer(String containerName,
                                       CloudStorageClass cloudStorageClass)
                                         throws ClientException,
                                                ServiceException
        Description copied from interface: CloudClient
        Creates a Server-Side Encryption enabled storage cloud container of specified name and storage class.

        This creates a container with a BASE_ENCRYPTION policy.

        Specified by:
        createSSEEnabledContainer in interface CloudClient
        Parameters:
        containerName - container name
        cloudStorageClass - storage class for the new container
        Returns:
        storage cloud container
        Throws:
        ClientException
        ServiceException

      • setObjectMetadata

        public void setObjectMetadata(String containerName,
                     String objectName,
                     Map<String,String> customMetadata,
                     Map<String,String> systemMetadata)
                       throws ClientException,
                              ServiceException
        Description copied from interface: CloudClient
        Sets meta-data for an object.

        The specified custom and system meta-data are set as new meta-data for an object. This method deletes all the previous meta-data of the object that is not specified in the parameters custom and system meta-data. (Note: Only certain system meta-data can be deleted by this method.)

        Mete-data Keys:

        • Meta-data keys (or names) are treated as case-insensitive. These keys can contain ASCII 7-bit characters that are not control (0-31) characters, DEL, or a separator character. The underscore character is silently converted to a hyphen.
        • The custom meta-data keys are prefixed with 'x-object-meta-', if the prefix is not already present.
        • A system mete-data key-value pair with an invalid key is ignored. Refer to the cloud service documentation for all valid system meta-data names.

        Mete-data values:

        • The values must contain only UTF-8 characters. This method URL encodes the custom meta-data values before sending these as REST API headers. So the parameters must contain raw strings as values for custom meta-data. This method does not encode the system meta-data values.
        • If a new (custom or system) mete-data specified in the parameters has a null value, then that meta-data is ignored. If an existing meta-data key is specified in the parameters with a null value, then that meta-data is deleted.
        • If a new system mete-data key-value specified in the parameter (system mete-data) contains an empty string value, then that key-value pair is ignored. If an existing system meta-data key is specified in the parameter (system mete-data) with a null value, then that mete-data gets deleted.

        Refer to the cloud storage service documentation for additional restrictions and details about the meta-data keys and values.

        Specified by:
        setObjectMetadata in interface CloudClient
        Parameters:
        containerName - container name
        objectName - object name
        customMetadata - custom meta-data as key-value pairs
        systemMetadata - system meta-data as key-value pairs
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFound - if the object does not exist
        ClientException
        ServiceException

      • updateObjectMetadata

        public void updateObjectMetadata(String containerName,
                        String objectName,
                        Map<String,String> customMetadata,
                        Map<String,String> systemMetadata)
                          throws ClientException,
                                 ServiceException
        Description copied from interface: CloudClient
        Updates (or deletes) meta-data of an object.

        The specified custom and system meta-data is added, updated or deleted. The meta-data that is not specified in parameters custom and system meta-data is not modified by this method. To delete a meta-data, specify the value of the meta-data as null. (Note: Only certain system meta-data can be deleted by this method.)

        This method works as if the existing meta-data of the object is merged with the meta-data parameters of this method and then calling CloudClient.setObjectMetadata(String, String, Map, Map) by providing this merged meta-data.The notes about mete-data keys and values in the method CloudClient.setObjectMetadata(String, String, Map, Map) apply to this method as well.

        Specified by:
        updateObjectMetadata in interface CloudClient
        Parameters:
        containerName - container name
        objectName - object name
        customMetadata - custom mete-data as key-value pairs
        systemMetadata - system meta-data as key-value pairs
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFound - if the object does not exist
        ClientException
        ServiceException

      • updateContainerMetadata

        public void updateContainerMetadata(String containerName,
                           Map<String,String> customMetadata,
                           Map<String,String> systemMetadata)
                             throws ClientException,
                                    ServiceException
        Description copied from interface: CloudClient
        Updates meta-data for a container.

        The specified custom and system meta-data are added, updated or deleted for a container. The meta-data that is not specified in the parameters custom and system meta-data is not modified by this method. To delete a meta-data key-value pair, specify the value of the meta-data as null. (Note: Only certain system meta-data can be deleted by this method.)

        Mete-data Keys:

        • Meta-data keys (or names) are treated as case-insensitive. These keys can contain ASCII 7-bit characters that are not control (0-31) characters, DEL, or a separator character. The underscore character is silently converted to a hyphen.
        • The custom meta-data keys are prefixed with 'x-container-meta-', if the prefix is not already present.
        • A system mete-data key-value pair with an invalid key is ignored. Refer to the cloud service documentation for all valid system meta-data names.

        Mete-data values:

        • The values must contain only UTF-8 characters. This method URL encodes the custom meta-data values before sending these as REST API headers. So the parameters must contain raw strings as values for custom meta-data. This method does not encode the system meta-data values.
        • If a new (custom or system) mete-data key-value pair specified in the parameters has an empty or null value, then that meta-data key-value pair is ignored. If an existing meta-data key is specified in the parameters with a null value, then that meta-data gets deleted.

        Refer to the cloud storage service documentation for additional restrictions and details about the meta-data keys and values.

        Specified by:
        updateContainerMetadata in interface CloudClient
        Parameters:
        containerName - container name
        customMetadata - custom meta-data as key-value pairs
        systemMetadata - system meta-data as key-value pairs
        Throws:
        ContainerNotFound - if the container does not exist
        ClientException
        ServiceException

      • updateAccountMetadata

        public void updateAccountMetadata(Map<String,String> customMetadata,
                         Map<String,String> systemMetadata)
                           throws ClientException,
                                  ServiceException
        Description copied from interface: CloudClient
        Updates meta-data for an account.

        The specified custom and system meta-data are added, updated or deleted for an account. The meta-data that is not specified in the parameters custom and system meta-data is not modified by this method. To delete a meta-data key-value pair, specify the value of the meta-data as null.

        Note: As of this release, the storage service does not support any modifiable system meta-data. So system meta-data parameter does not change any of the account's meta-data.

        Mete-data Keys:

        • Meta-data keys (or names) are treated as case-insensitive. These keys can contain ASCII 7-bit characters that are not control (0-31) characters, DEL, or a separator character. The underscore character is silently converted to a hyphen.
        • The custom meta-data keys are prefixed with 'x-account-meta-', if the prefix is not already present.
        • A system mete-data key-value pair with an invalid key is ignored. Refer to the cloud service documentation for all valid system meta-data names.

        Mete-data values:

        • The values must contain only UTF-8 characters. This method URL encodes the custom meta-data values before sending these as REST API headers. So the values (specified in the parameters) must contain raw strings. This method does not encode the system meta-data values.
        • If a new (custom or system) mete-data key-value pair specified in the parameters has an empty or null value, then that meta-data key-value pair is ignored. If an existing meta-data key is specified in the parameters with a null value, then that meta-data gets deleted.

        Refer to the cloud storage service documentation for additional restrictions and details about the meta-data keys and values.

        Specified by:
        updateAccountMetadata in interface CloudClient
        Parameters:
        customMetadata - custom meta-data as key-value pairs
        systemMetadata - system meta-data as key-value pairs
        Throws:
        ClientException
        ServiceException
